column1: Optimizing ferry schedules and fleet usage involves several steps
column4: and proposing changes. The primary goals here are to reduce trip frequency during late-night hours and to retain the Fragancia for all operations to minimize emissions.

column1: Here is a proposed optimized schedule for the Oxdjupsleden route:
Peak hours: Two ferries (Fragancia and an additional ferry if necessary) operate on the route to handle the increased passenger volume.
Off-peak hours: Only Fragancia operates on the route

The proposed changes are feasible considering the short crossing time of 3 minutes on the Oxdjupsleden route. The Fragancia can handle the reduced late-night frequency without causing significant delays.
By using the Fragancia exclusively during off-peak hours
column2: emissions will be significantly reduced. The exact amount will depend on the difference in emissions between Fragancia and the other ferries
column3: which is not provided in the data.

column1: The demand should be adequately met with the new schedule. During peak hours
column2: the additional ferry can handle the increased passenger volume. During off-peak hours
column3: the reduced frequency is still sufficient to meet the lower demand.

column1: Please note that this is a preliminary analysis. Further data on passenger demand
column3: and emissions would allow for a more detailed and accurate optimization.
